title: Instruction Letter on Control of Records (IGS-S620-05) | Yönerge
text: Instruction No IGS-S620-05-V12 Effective Date 09-03-2012 Update Date 25-06-2025 Related Unit / Owner GS / Genel Sekreter Approved by BT / Board of Trustees Aim This instruction letter determines the principles regarding the storage of records required for the execution of Sabancı University processes within the scope of the Integrated Management System. Scope This instruction letter defines the general framework regarding how, where, by whom, for how long the records required for the execution of Sabancı University processes within the scope of the Integrated Management System are stored and how they are backed up. Principle In order for processes to be carried out at Sabancı University, records must be stored for the specified periods. Statutory Basis ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management System, ISO 14001:2015 Environmental Management System and ISO 45001:2018 Occupational Health and Safety Management System Standards are essential. Legislative provisions are also observed on a process basis and relevant references are defined in the documents. Definitions / Abbreviations SU: Sabancı University Administrative Units: Units reporting to the Secretary General, whose employees are the SU administrative staff. Integrated Management System Leader: SU employee working on the Integrated Management System in the General Secretariat Office. Docserver: A common storage area provided by the Information Technology Unit to other units, accessible by authorized employees and used by accessing via the network. Document: Refers to all SU Regulations, Instruction Letters, Procedures, and Forms, in other words, Integrated System documents. Process Map Web: This is the website where all integrated documents of SU are published, which is open only to SU members at http://mysu.sabanciuniv.edu/surecharitasi . Regulations Rules 1. The administrative unit managers are responsible for keeping, updating, and archiving records related to the processes within the scope of SU. Records consist of the following. In addition to these, the records to be kept are determined by the relevant process owners. a. Forms published within the scope of process documents and to be filled out by process customers or responsible persons, b. Information stored in databases, c. Official correspondence, d. Meeting minutes, e. Customer satisfaction measurement results, f. Performance indicators results, g. Feedback from process customers, h. Environmental impact assessment, i. OHS risk assessment. 2. The following records may be stored in printed or electronic form. Examples of places where records may be stored are as follows: a. Folders where printed documents are stored. These folders are either archived or kept in office filing cabinets. Folders must be organized according to the rules defined in Correspondence Management, C870 University Archives Document Management process. b. Electronic folders on Docserver reserved for the shared use of relevant process managers. c. Software and applications that keep databases and archive records. d. Electronic mails stored on the server or copied to Docserver. The security of printed records is the responsibility of the relevant process managers. Electronic records are regularly backed up in accordance with the Information Security Management Instruction Letter (IIT-S130-02). 3. The following places are not secure record storage areas: a. Personal computers. b. Electronic mails downloaded to personal computers. c. Websites. These areas should not be used as storage locations. However, the security and backup responsibility of these environments lies entirely with the user. 4. The storage period of all records is determined by the manager of the relevant process owner unit and is recorded in the Integrated Records List Form (FGS-620-05-01). At this point, if there is a legal period determined for the subject, the shortest storage period to be determined should be this period. 5. The current version of the Integrated Management System documents related to the process is published in Turkish on the Process Map "Principles and Instruction Letters" web page. All printed documents are uncontrolled copies. 6. The manager of each process owner unit keeps a list of the records related to the processes they own according to the record titles with the Integrated Records List Form (FGS-S620-05-01) and updates it in case of a change in the relevant record.
